content.raw:
I understand the AWS limitation you let us know about yesterday and that was the reason I only ran three runs overnight. 

From a user perspective, I and others are getting effectively zero runs through.  Overnight I had one run never start, one run fail for unknown  admin reasons and one fail due to some internal cloudsim issues \(#246\).   Others are seeing and submitting similar problems. 

Debugging locally is fine to a point, but aws cloudsim behaves differently than local runs of any sort.  So, testing has to be done on AWS to work out those issues.  It is that final testing that is really not possible right now.

‌

I understand the AWS limitation you let us know about yesterday and that was the reason I only ran three runs overnight.

From a user perspective, I and others are getting effectively zero runs through. Overnight I had one run never start, one run fail for unknown admin reasons and one fail due to some internal cloudsim issues (#246). Others are seeing and submitting similar problems.

Debugging locally is fine to a point, but aws cloudsim behaves differently than local runs of any sort. So, testing has to be done on AWS to work out those issues. It is that final testing that is really not possible right now.
